titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Percy Simpson Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:35

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, scrapbooks and printed material documenting aspects of the scholarly career of Percy Simpson, particularly his edition of Ben Jonson's Works (1925-52) and his professional relationships with his colleagues, especially C. H. Herford, R. W. Chapman, William A. Jackson, Sir Humphrey Sumner Milford, and Eugénie Sellers Strong.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For further information, please consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Percy Simpson Papers are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs or assigns. For further information, consult the apropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Percy Simpson Papers. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: CONTENTS OF BOXES

Box 1 -- 2 Scrapbooks, containing press cuttings, 1870-1953
5 Letters to Simpson Misc. Memorabilia from Awards of Honorary Degrees
Box 2 -- Notebooks 1-6
Box 3 -- Notebooks 7-14
Box 4 -- Folder 1 Off-prints of articles published by Simpson 1896-1953
-------- Folder 2 Off-prints of reviews by Simpson
-------- Folder 3 Off-prints of Simpson's colleagues
-------- Folder 4 Misc. printed matter
Box 5 -- Folder 1 Notes on proofreading and punctuation
-------- Folder 2 Notes, facsimiles, correspondence related to proofreading
-------- Folder 3 20th-Century theater programs
-------- Folder 4 "Monthly Letters" of William Poel
Box 6 -- Folder 1 Photostats for "paradoxes and problems"
-------- Folder 2 Photostats of Jonson texts
-------- Folder 3 Misc. photostats and facsimiles
-------- Folder 4 Notes on Jonson
-------- Folder 5 Notes for "Love's Martyr"
-------- Folder 6 Notes, correspondence relating to Jonson portraits
-------- Folder 7 Notes on Jonson's library
-------- Folder 8 Plates, proofs for "Masque of Queens"
-------- Folder 9 Notes on Lucy, Countess of Bedford
-------- Folder 10 Notes on Shakespeare plays
-------- Folder 11 Notes for "Shakespearean Punctuation"
-------- Folder 12 Typescript of "Shakespeare's Latin"
Box 7 -- Folder 1 Notes for teaching of Greek, 1883-84
-------- Folder 2 Lecture notes for course in Bibliography, 1913-19
-------- Folder 3 Notes, lecture notes on Matthew Arnold
-------- Folder 4 Personal items
-------- Folder 5 Bibliographical Society and Oxford Bibliographical Society materials, 1915-53
-------- Folder 6 Misc. notes by Simpson
-------- Folder 7 Notes on Chapman's Homer
-------- Folder 8 Notes on Huchon(?)
-------- Folder 9 Notes on Corpus Christi (Oxford) MS 325
-------- Folder 10 Notes on Phillips MS 9624 (Brodbent)
-------- Folder 11 Tutor play fragment (Wadham College, Oxford)
-------- Folder 12 Notes of Trinity College (Cambridge) MS B.14,22
-------- Folder 13 Notes on Cicero
-------- Folder 14 Materials from Oriel College (Oxford) Sexcentury, 1926
-------- Folder 15 Misc. typescripts
Boxes 8-10 -- Correspondence

did.unittitle: Two large scrapbooks containing press cuttings from TLS , Notes and Queries , The Oxford Magazine , Athenaeum , Modern Language Quarterly , Modern Language Review , The London Times , Oxford University Gazette , Oriel College Record , The Denstonian , The Periodical , The Glasgow Herald , Radio Times . Most concern issues in Jonson scholarship, but several reviews by Simpson are included, 1870-1953.
The volumes also contain memorabilia from Awarding of Honorary Degrees from Cambridge and Glasgow Universities, 1951.
5 Letters to Simpson are enclosed, as follows:

did.unittitle: 1. Translations of English writers into Greek prose
2. Translations of English writers into Latin prose
3. Translations of English writers into Greek verse
4. Translations of English writers into Latin verse
5. Notebook: sections of French translations of English prose; incomplete Greek-English Lexicon; misc. quotations and notes
6. Notebook: "Lectures by Dr. Reid given at Pembroke College, May Term 1885; Selections from Pliny's Letters"
8. Notes on Julius Caesar , Acts I-V
9. Notes on MS pedigree and migrations for Chaucer texts and their sources, esp. Boccaccio.
10. Notes on "The Vernon MS" (Bod. MS Engl. Poet. A1). Misc. notes on physical and textual aspects.
11. Notes on Jonson's Batholomew Fair [contains misc. notes and press cuttings related to Bartholomew Fair ].

12. Notes on MSS: Trinity College, Dublin MS G-2-21 [Donne poems and others]; "The Books of the Revells Ending the Last Day of October, An. Dom.: 1612;" Edinburgh University MS of Jonson's Poems, 1640
13. Notebook: "Gur Magazine. Edited by Lady EMS. Saturday, March 13th, 1897." MS installments [not in Simpson's hand] run to Saturday, May 8th, 1897, a total of 62 pages.
